properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.additional-properties
properties.description: Additional properties for debezium components in case they can't be set directly on the camel configurations (e.g: setting Kafka Connect properties needed by Debezium engine, for example setting KafkaOffsetBackingStore), the properties have to be prefixed with additionalProperties.. E.g: additionalProperties.transactional.id=12345&additionalProperties.schema.registry.url=http://localhost:8811/avro

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.binary-handling-mode
properties.description: Specify how binary (blob, binary, etc.) columns should be represented in change events, including:'bytes' represents binary data as byte array (default)'base64' represents binary data as base64-encoded string'hex' represents binary data as hex-encoded (base16) string

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.bridge-error-handler
properties.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.column-blacklist
properties.description: Regular expressions matching columns to exclude from change events (deprecated, use column.exclude.list instead)

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.column-exclude-list
properties.description: Regular expressions matching columns to exclude from change events

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.column-include-list
properties.description: Regular expressions matching columns to include in change events

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.column-propagate-source-type
properties.description: A comma-separated list of regular expressions matching fully-qualified names of columns that adds the columns original type and original length as parameters to the corresponding field schemas in the emitted change records.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.column-whitelist
properties.description: Regular expressions matching columns to include in change events (deprecated, use column.include.list instead)

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.configuration
properties.description: Allow pre-configured Configurations to be set. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.debezium.configuration.SqlServerConnectorEmbeddedDebeziumConfiguration type.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.converters
properties.description: Optional list of custom converters that would be used instead of default ones. The converters are defined using '.type' config option and configured using options '.'

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.database-dbname
properties.description: The name of the database the connector should be monitoring

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.database-history
properties.description: The name of the DatabaseHistory class that should be used to store and recover database schema changes. The configuration properties for the history are prefixed with the 'database.history.' string.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.database-history-file-filename
properties.description: The path to the file that will be used to record the database history

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.database-history-kafka-bootstrap-servers
properties.description: A list of host/port pairs that the connector will use for establishing the initial connection to the Kafka cluster for retrieving database schema history previously stored by the connector. This should point to the same Kafka cluster used by the Kafka Connect process.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.database-history-kafka-recovery-attempts
properties.description: The number of attempts in a row that no data are returned from Kafka before recover completes. The maximum amount of time to wait after receiving no data is (recovery.attempts) x (recovery.poll.interval.ms).

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.database-history-kafka-recovery-poll-interval-ms
properties.description: The number of milliseconds to wait while polling for persisted data during recovery. The option is a int type.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.database-history-kafka-topic
properties.description: The name of the topic for the database schema history

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.database-hostname
properties.description: Resolvable hostname or IP address of the database server.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.database-instance
properties.description: The SQL Server instance name

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.database-password
properties.description: Password of the database user to be used when connecting to the database.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.database-port
properties.description: Port of the database server.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.database-server-name
properties.description: Unique name that identifies the database server and all recorded offsets, and that is used as a prefix for all schemas and topics. Each distinct installation should have a separate namespace and be monitored by at most one Debezium connector.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.database-server-timezone
properties.description: The timezone of the server used to correctly shift the commit transaction timestamp on the client sideOptions include: Any valid Java ZoneId

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.database-user
properties.description: Name of the database user to be used when connecting to the database.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.datatype-propagate-source-type
properties.description: A comma-separated list of regular expressions matching the database-specific data type names that adds the data type's original type and original length as parameters to the corresponding field schemas in the emitted change records.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.decimal-handling-mode
properties.description: Specify how DECIMAL and NUMERIC columns should be represented in change events, including:'precise' (the default) uses java.math.BigDecimal to represent values, which are encoded in the change events using a binary representation and Kafka Connect's 'org.apache.kafka.connect.data.Decimal' type; 'string' uses string to represent values; 'double' represents values using Java's 'double', which may not offer the precision but will be far easier to use in consumers.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the debezium-sqlserver component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.event-processing-failure-handling-mode
properties.description: Specify how failures during processing of events (i.e. when encountering a corrupted event) should be handled, including:'fail' (the default) an exception indicating the problematic event and its position is raised, causing the connector to be stopped; 'warn' the problematic event and its position will be logged and the event will be skipped;'ignore' the problematic event will be skipped.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.heartbeat-interval-ms
properties.description: Length of an interval in milli-seconds in in which the connector periodically sends heartbeat messages to a heartbeat topic. Use 0 to disable heartbeat messages. Disabled by default. The option is a int type.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.heartbeat-topics-prefix
properties.description: The prefix that is used to name heartbeat topics.Defaults to __debezium-heartbeat.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.include-schema-changes
properties.description: Whether the connector should publish changes in the database schema to a Kafka topic with the same name as the database server ID. Each schema change will be recorded using a key that contains the database name and whose value include logical description of the new schema and optionally the DDL statement(s).The default is 'true'. This is independent of how the connector internally records database history.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.internal-key-converter
properties.description: The Converter class that should be used to serialize and deserialize key data for offsets. The default is JSON converter.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.internal-value-converter
properties.description: The Converter class that should be used to serialize and deserialize value data for offsets. The default is JSON converter.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.max-batch-size
properties.description: Maximum size of each batch of source records. Defaults to 2048.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.max-queue-size
properties.description: Maximum size of the queue for change events read from the database log but not yet recorded or forwarded. Defaults to 8192, and should always be larger than the maximum batch size.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.max-queue-size-in-bytes
properties.description: Maximum size of the queue in bytes for change events read from the database log but not yet recorded or forwarded. Defaults to 0. Mean the feature is not enabled

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.message-key-columns
properties.description: A semicolon-separated list of expressions that match fully-qualified tables and column(s) to be used as message key. Each expression must match the pattern ':',where the table names could be defined as (DB_NAME.TABLE_NAME) or (SCHEMA_NAME.TABLE_NAME), depending on the specific connector,and the key columns are a comma-separated list of columns representing the custom key. For any table without an explicit key configuration the table's primary key column(s) will be used as message key.Example: dbserver1.inventory.orderlines:orderId,orderLineId;dbserver1.inventory.orders:id

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.offset-commit-policy
properties.description: The name of the Java class of the commit policy. It defines when offsets commit has to be triggered based on the number of events processed and the time elapsed since the last commit. This class must implement the interface 'OffsetCommitPolicy'. The default is a periodic commit policy based upon time intervals.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.offset-commit-timeout-ms
properties.description: Maximum number of milliseconds to wait for records to flush and partition offset data to be committed to offset storage before cancelling the process and restoring the offset data to be committed in a future attempt. The default is 5 seconds. The option is a long type.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.offset-flush-interval-ms
properties.description: Interval at which to try committing offsets. The default is 1 minute. The option is a long type.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.offset-storage
properties.description: The name of the Java class that is responsible for persistence of connector offsets.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.offset-storage-file-name
properties.description: Path to file where offsets are to be stored. Required when offset.storage is set to the FileOffsetBackingStore.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.offset-storage-partitions
properties.description: The number of partitions used when creating the offset storage topic. Required when offset.storage is set to the 'KafkaOffsetBackingStore'.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.offset-storage-replication-factor
properties.description: Replication factor used when creating the offset storage topic. Required when offset.storage is set to the KafkaOffsetBackingStore

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.offset-storage-topic
properties.description: The name of the Kafka topic where offsets are to be stored. Required when offset.storage is set to the KafkaOffsetBackingStore.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.poll-interval-ms
properties.description: Time to wait for new change events to appear after receiving no events, given in milliseconds. Defaults to 500 ms. The option is a long type.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.provide-transaction-metadata
properties.description: Enables transaction metadata extraction together with event counting

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.query-fetch-size
properties.description: The maximum number of records that should be loaded into memory while streaming. A value of 0 uses the default JDBC fetch size.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.retriable-restart-connector-wait-ms
properties.description: Time to wait before restarting connector after retriable exception occurs. Defaults to 10000ms. The option is a long type.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.sanitize-field-names
properties.description: Whether field names will be sanitized to Avro naming conventions

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.signal-data-collection
properties.description: The name of the data collection that is used to send signals/commands to Debezium. Signaling is disabled when not set.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.skipped-operations
properties.description: The comma-separated list of operations to skip during streaming, defined as: 'c' for inserts/create; 'u' for updates; 'd' for deletes. By default, no operations will be skipped.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.snapshot-delay-ms
properties.description: A delay period before a snapshot will begin, given in milliseconds. Defaults to 0 ms. The option is a long type.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.snapshot-fetch-size
properties.description: The maximum number of records that should be loaded into memory while performing a snapshot

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.snapshot-include-collection-list
properties.description: this setting must be set to specify a list of tables/collections whose snapshot must be taken on creating or restarting the connector.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.snapshot-isolation-mode
properties.description: Controls which transaction isolation level is used and how long the connector locks the monitored tables. The default is 'repeatable_read', which means that repeatable read isolation level is used. In addition, exclusive locks are taken only during schema snapshot. Using a value of 'exclusive' ensures that the connector holds the exclusive lock (and thus prevents any reads and updates) for all monitored tables during the entire snapshot duration. When 'snapshot' is specified, connector runs the initial snapshot in SNAPSHOT isolation level, which guarantees snapshot consistency. In addition, neither table nor row-level locks are held. When 'read_committed' is specified, connector runs the initial snapshot in READ COMMITTED isolation level. No long-running locks are taken, so that initial snapshot does not prevent other transactions from updating table rows. Snapshot consistency is not guaranteed.In 'read_uncommitted' mode neither table nor row-level locks are acquired, but connector does not guarantee snapshot consistency.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.snapshot-lock-timeout-ms
properties.description: The maximum number of millis to wait for table locks at the beginning of a snapshot. If locks cannot be acquired in this time frame, the snapshot will be aborted. Defaults to 10 seconds. The option is a long type.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.snapshot-max-threads
properties.description: The maximum number of threads used to perform the snapshot. Defaults to 1.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.snapshot-mode
properties.description: The criteria for running a snapshot upon startup of the connector. Options include: 'initial' (the default) to specify the connector should run a snapshot only when no offsets are available for the logical server name; 'schema_only' to specify the connector should run a snapshot of the schema when no offsets are available for the logical server name.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.snapshot-select-statement-overrides
properties.description: This property contains a comma-separated list of fully-qualified tables (DB_NAME.TABLE_NAME) or (SCHEMA_NAME.TABLE_NAME), depending on thespecific connectors . Select statements for the individual tables are specified in further configuration properties, one for each table, identified by the id 'snapshot.select.statement.overrides.DB_NAME.TABLE_NAME' or 'snapshot.select.statement.overrides.SCHEMA_NAME.TABLE_NAME', respectively. The value of those properties is the select statement to use when retrieving data from the specific table during snapshotting. A possible use case for large append-only tables is setting a specific point where to start (resume) snapshotting, in case a previous snapshotting was interrupted.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.source-struct-version
properties.description: A version of the format of the publicly visible source part in the message

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.source-timestamp-mode
properties.description: Configures the criteria of the attached timestamp within the source record (ts_ms).Options include:'commit', (default) the source timestamp is set to the instant where the record was committed in the database'processing', the source timestamp is set to the instant where the record was processed by Debezium.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.table-blacklist
properties.description: A comma-separated list of regular expressions that match the fully-qualified names of tables to be excluded from monitoring (deprecated, use table.exclude.list instead)

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.table-exclude-list
properties.description: A comma-separated list of regular expressions that match the fully-qualified names of tables to be excluded from monitoring

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.table-ignore-builtin
properties.description: Flag specifying whether built-in tables should be ignored.

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.table-include-list
properties.description: The tables for which changes are to be captured

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.table-whitelist
properties.description: The tables for which changes are to be captured (deprecated, use table.include.list instead)

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.time-precision-mode
properties.description: Time, date, and timestamps can be represented with different kinds of precisions, including:'adaptive' (the default) bases the precision of time, date, and timestamp values on the database column's precision; 'adaptive_time_microseconds' like 'adaptive' mode, but TIME fields always use microseconds precision;'connect' always represents time, date, and timestamp values using Kafka Connect's built-in representations for Time, Date, and Timestamp, which uses millisecond precision regardless of the database columns' precision .

properties.name: camel.component.debezium-sqlserver.tombstones-on-delete
properties.description: Whether delete operations should be represented by a delete event and a subsquenttombstone event (true) or only by a delete event (false). Emitting the tombstone event (the default behavior) allows Kafka to completely delete all events pertaining to the given key once the source record got deleted.
